text: Annabelle Allan Short (25 July 1930 - 21 July 2020), known professionally as Annie Ross, was a British-American jazz singer-songwriter and actress. She was best known as a member of the jazz vocal trio Lambert, Hendricks & Ross. She also wrote the song "Twisted". An actress, she appeared in the movie Short Cuts. Ross was born in London. Ross died on 21 July 2020 in New York City from problems caused by emphysema and heart disease, four days before her 90th birthday.‘Twisted’ lyricist, vocalese pioneer Annie Ross has Died ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from emphysema Category:Deaths from heart disease Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:British pianists Category:British movie actors Category:American jazz musicians Category:American jazz singers Category:American movie actors Category:Singer- songwriters from London Category:Actors from London
title: Annie Ross
